A user account on the site.  Most of the relevant data for the user is not here, but in

The description of this event, rendered to HTML

classes.name: ScheduledValueDrop

A ScheduledValue represents a value that changes over time.  For example, the convention's
maximum allowed signups and the price of ticket types are ScheduledValues.

The current time, as used for calculating the value of
this ScheduledValue

The time zone used for calculating the value of this
ScheduledValue
Whether or not this ScheduledValue covers all possible times
a new instance of ScheduledValueDrop

The timespans covered by this ScheduledValue, along with
the value for that range of time
The current value of this ScheduledValue (type may vary)
When the current value came into effect
When the value will next change
What the value will be after it next changes (type may vary)

classes.name: UserConProfileDrop
classes.docstring:
A profile for a user attending a convention.  This is the main object used for all user-specific
data in a convention, rather than User, which is just the sitewide account data shared between
all conventions.

tags.text:
The name used for the user's bio, which will either include a nickname or not
depending on their preference
The user's email address
The user's first name
The URL of the user's Gravatar
The numeric database ID of the user profile
The user's last name
The user's name, including nickname if present
The user's name in "Last, First" format
The nickname the user entered on their profile
The user's name, not including nickname
The user's convention ticket, if present

The user's iCal secret for this convention (used in the
{% add_to_calendar_dropdown %} tag)
a new instance of UserConProfileDrop

All the active events at this convention for which this user is a
team member
All the user's signups, excluding withdrawn events
The user's bio, as HTML

Privileges have been removed in favor of permissions and staff positions.  This
method still exists for compatibility reasons but will return either an empty array or an
array containing only the string 'site_admin'.
The user's privileges for this convention
All the staff positions this user holds at this convention
All the event proposals this user submitted for this convention

A webcal:// URL for the user's personal schedule for this convention.  This URL
is considered secret and should only be given to that user.

classes.name: CmsVariable
classes.docstring:
A convention-specific variable.  To set the values of these variables, go to Admin -> Site
Content -> Variables.

filter_methods.name: pluralize
filter_methods.docstring:
Can be used to either pluralize a singular noun, or to conditionally pluralize a noun based
on a count.

tags.name: Pluralizing a noun unconditionally
tags.text: {{ "goose" | pluralize }} => "geese"

tags.name: Pluralizing a count
tags.text:
You are signed up for {{ user_con_profile.signups.length | pluralize "game" "games" }}
=> "You are signed up for 3 games"

tags.name: input
tags.text:
The input to pluralize.  If it's a string, that string will
be unconditionally pluralized.  If it's a number, pluralize
will read the singular and plural parameters and decide
between them depending on whether input is 1.

tags.name: singular
tags.text:
Optional.  If input is a number, this will be the result if input
is 1.

tags.name: plural
tags.text:
Optional.  If input is a number, this will be the result if input is
not 1.
String

filter_methods.name: email_link
filter_methods.docstring:
Outputs either a clickable mailto: link (if the user is currently logged in), or an
obfuscated email (if the user is not logged in).  The intent of this is to be a spammer-safe
way to link to email addresses.

tags.name: When logged in
tags.text: {{ "test@example.com" | email_link }} => test@example.com

tags.name: When not logged in
tags.text:
{{ "test@example.com" | email_link }}
=> test AT example DOT com

tags.name: input
tags.text: An email address
String A spammer-safe HTML representation of the email address

filter_methods.name: to_sentence
filter_methods.docstring: Given an array of strings, outputs an English representation of that array.

tags.name: One string
tags.text: {{ ["one fish"] | to_sentence }} => one fish

tags.name: Two strings
tags.text: {{ ["one fish", "two fish"] | to_sentence }} => one fish and two fish

tags.name: More than two strings
tags.text:
{{ ["one fish", "two fish", "red fish", "blue fish"] | to_sentence }}
=> one fish, two fish, red fish, and blue fish

tags.name: input
tags.text: An array of strings
String

filter_methods.name: humanize
filter_methods.docstring: Runs a string through the Ruby on Rails "humanize" filter.

tags.text: the Rails documentation for this method

filter_methods.name: absolute_url
filter_methods.docstring:
Given a relative URL, turns it into an absolute URL for the current convention.
Given an absolute URL, changes the hostname to the current convention host.

filter_methods.name: condense_whitespace
filter_methods.docstring:
Converts all whitespace in a string to single spaces, and strips whitespace off the
beginning and end.
